title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: For a chemical reaction to proceed spontaneously, it typically needs to have an overall decrease in free energy. The change in Gibbs free energy gives you a direct measure of this tendency.

title: Gibbs Free Energy Formula
text:
The Gibbs free energy change equation is given by the formula:
ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS
where:
- ΔG is the change in Gibbs free energy,
- ΔH is the change in enthalpy,
- T is the temperature (in Kelvin),
- ΔS is the change in entropy.

title: Condition for Spontaneity
text: A reaction is spontaneous when the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) is negative.

title: Setting the Equation for Spontaneity
text: Given ΔG < $$0$$, or ΔH - TΔS < $$0$$. Rearrange this to find the condition under given temperature T.
